message: Do there exist? If so, the ones you like
What do you mean by HTML5? I'm about to roll out a site using jQmobile. It's a pretty aggressive but useful library.
what mobile browsers support html5, i don't think the iphone safari supports html5 i am probably wrong but i haven't heard anything about it

Again, that depends on what you mean by HTML5. <audio> and <video> are in mobile safari. As well as client-side storage and databases. And of course there's the markup which you can use with a simple CSS reset. There's probably more but that's what I've personally used. Android has these too. Not sure about blackberry. If what I read is correct, WinPhone7 is about to get a small screen version of IE9 with everything the desktop version supports.
For what it's worth, I've been using JQmobile to develop a Blackberry Playbook app.  It's worked really well, once I got used to the convention.

@jefflarkin ya I did one project where I added it on the another where I did the templates from the start to support jQm. The second was almost as easy as including the CSS and JavaScript files. Just minor theme tweaking after that.
@dryan I think starting from scratch with it is the way to go.  I can't imagine trying to make jqm fit into an exiting mobile project.

We're using a lot jQuery Mobile at Quick Left right now. "Aggressive" is probably the most accurate description for this library I've heard so far. The docs are also a little slim, and we've had to monkeypatch it in a few places to achieve some things that will likely be a part of the library later on (data exchange between views and caching)
Overall it's definitely allowed us to move quickly towards an MVP release across several platforms.
Available on openapp market sorry for lack of links on my phone

@dryan whats the name of your app? I'm developing for tge PlayBook too. Lets get together to hack!
@operator m.ypchattanooga.org is the one that's currently live. I'm working on converting a second mobile site now.
